security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference material for Portfolio Buddy 2. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution. Safe for distribution.

content.value_statement: Quick reference for Portfolio Buddy 2 project structure. Contains component hierarchy, hook patterns, utility functions, and data flow documentation for faster development.
actual_capabilities: Provides component hierarchy with parent-child relationships
Documents key hooks: useMetrics, usePortfolio, useSorting, useContractMultipliers
Lists utility functions for CSV parsing, metrics calculation, and correlation analysis
Explains data flow from upload through metrics display
Documents state management patterns using React hooks
Covers Chart.js integration and performance optimization patterns
limitations: Provides documentation only, does not modify or generate code
Reference is specific to Portfolio Buddy 2 project structure
Does not execute code or access external files or APIs

best_practices: Follow the use prefix naming convention for custom hooks in src/hooks/
Use useMemo for expensive calculations and useCallback for stable callbacks
Add JSDoc comments for complex logic and export all interfaces for type safety
Keep components under 200 lines by extracting sub-components when growing larger
anti_patterns: Avoid using TypeScript any type - define proper interfaces for all data structures
Do not install or import Recharts - Chart.js is the established charting library
Avoid prop drilling through deep component trees - use custom hooks to share logic

faq.question: What charting library does Portfolio Buddy 2 use?
faq.answer: Portfolio Buddy 2 uses Chart.js 4.x with react-chartjs-2 wrapper. Recharts is installed but never imported.

faq.question: What is the target maximum component size?
faq.answer: Components should target 200 lines or less. PortfolioSection at 591 lines is flagged as a high priority refactor candidate.

faq.question: Does this skill access my files or project?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides only documentation reference. It does not read, write, or modify any files in your project.

faq.question: What state management approach does the project use?
faq.answer: The project uses plain React hooks (useState, useMemo, useCallback, useRef) without global state libraries like Redux or Zustand.

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides architecture guidance for all these AI assistants.

faq.question: How is data processed from upload to display?
faq.answer: Data flows through: CSV parse, currency cleaning, Supabase upload, usePortfolio aggregation, date filtering, useMetrics calculation, then MetricsTable display.
